resources.string: QuickMem is a flashcard app that helps you learn anything.
You can create your own flashcards and share them with others.
QuickMem uses spaced repetition to help you remember what you learn.
Are you a teacher or a student?
By signing up, you agree to the
Enter your birthday. This won\'t be visible to others.
Please enter the code we sent to your email
Save study sets for offline studying
Your 8 most recently studied sets will be saved for offline studying
Make your term and definition as clear as possible. You can add hint and explanation to help you remember better.
Group study materials to save time and share with other QuickMem members
You need to enable push notifications in the app settings
Get started by searching for a study set or creating your own
Organize your study sets in folders by subject, teacher, course, or any other way you like.
Tip: The more specific, the better!
Are you sure you want to delete this study set?
Are you sure you want to reset the progress of this study set?
You have not started any study set yet
Add your material to get started
This Study Set can contain flashcards, notes, and files on certain topic
Are you sure you want to delete this flashcard?
Add folders to share them with your class.
Are you sure you want to delete this folder?
The folder has no study sets
You must be at least 20 years old to change role. Please come back on %1$s.
Welcome back! Log in to your account
Keep up the streak to climb the leaderboard!
Warning: AI may not generate accurate or complete flashcards. Please review if unsure.
Practice every day so you don\'t lose your streak!
There are no folders yet, create one to get started!
There are no owned study sets, create one to get started!
Allow class members to send invites to others
Allow class members to add study sets and folders
Add members to share them with your class.
Add new study set to class
This class has no study sets
Add flashcard sets to share them with your class.
When you make a folder public, anyone can see it and use it.
Practice every day so you don\'t lose your streak!
To confirm it\'s really you, please enter your QuickMem password
You have reached the top %1$d on the Top Streak leaderboard!
Are you sure you want to delete this class?
Are you sure you want to exit this class?
To invite members to this class, add their QuickMem usernames below.
Turn on notifications to receive study reminders
You need to enable notifications in the app settings to receive study reminders
Keep focusing on your study set to master it!
Swipe left to mark as known
Swipe right to mark as still learning
You\'re doing great! Keep it up!
You have quite a lot of flashcards!
Do you want to split the flashcards into smaller parts to study?
You have finished this section of study set
Wait, don\'t go yet! You\'ll miss out on completing this study set!
You can not edit or learn this study set,just create a copy of it.
There is no hint for this flashcard.
There is no explanation for this flashcard.
Why are you reporting this class?
It is being used to cheat
It violates my intellectual property rights
I am having trouble joining this class
Why are you reporting this user?
Why are you reporting this folder?
It violates my intellectual property rights
Why are you reporting this set?
It is being used to cheat
It violates my intellectual property rights
Time spent on each learning type
Click the icon to show hint if you feel stuck
When you make a study set public, anyone can see it and use it.
General subjects that do not fit into specific categories.
Anthropology is the study of human societies and cultures.
Architecture and design is the study of buildings, structures, and spaces.
Arts is the study of creative expressions in various forms like painting, music, and sculpture.
Biology is the study of living organisms and life processes.
Business is the study of commerce, trade, and organizational management.
Chemistry is the study of substances, their properties, and reactions.
Computer Science is the study of computational systems, algorithms, and programming.
Earth Science is the study of the Earth, its composition, and natural phenomena.
Economics is the study of the production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.
Transportation is the study of the movement of people and goods and the infrastructure that supports it.
Systems science is the study of complex systems, such as ecosystems, organizations, and technologies.
Space sciences explore the study of the universe, celestial bodies, and cosmic phenomena.
Sociology is the study of human societies, social behavior, and social structures.
Social work is the study of helping individuals, families, and communities improve their well-being.
Religion and divinity focus on the study of faith, spirituality, and religious beliefs.
Public administration involves the management of government policies and programs.
Psychology is the study of the human mind, behavior, and mental processes.
Political science is the study of government systems, policies, and political behavior.
Physics is the study of matter, energy, and the laws governing the universe.
Philosophy is the study of existence, knowledge, and ethics.
Other fields of study that do not fit into traditional academic categories.
Military sciences study military tactics, defense strategies, and security systems.
Medicine is the study of health, diseases, and medical practices.
Mathematics is the study of numbers, quantities, shapes, and patterns.
Logic is the study of reasoning, critical thinking, and problem-solving methods.
Literature is the study of written works, such as novels, poetry, and plays.
Library and museum studies focus on the preservation and organization of information and artifacts.
Law is the study of legal systems, regulations, and justice.
Languages and cultures focus on linguistics, cultural practices, and communication across societies.
Journalism and media studies explore communication, reporting, and media\'s role in society.
Interdisciplinary studies involve integrating knowledge from multiple academic disciplines.
Human physical performance and recreation focuses on physical activities, sports, and overall well-being.
History is the study of past events, civilizations, and their impact on the present.
Geography is the study of places, landscapes, and the human-environment relationship.
Family and consumer science is the study of family dynamics, nutrition, and consumer behavior.
Environmental studies and forestry focus on the protection and management of natural resources and ecosystems.
Engineering and technology involves applying scientific knowledge to develop solutions for practical problems.
Password is too weak! Password must contain at least 8 characters, 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter, 1 number, and 1 special character.
You are member in this class
Join class by link with me: %1$s\n%2$s
Username must be at least 4 characters
You need at least 1 coin to create a study set
Too many requests, please wait 1 minute
Add study set to class successfully
Add study set to folder successfully
Failed to mark notification as read
Please enter a keyword to search images
